conclusion: Analyze mechanical energy changes during collision between block C and block B.
Setup with skateboard A at rest, spring attached to right end, block C slides onto skateboard from left with initial velocity v0, collides with block B.
Block C initially has kinetic energy due to velocity v0; skateboard A and blocks B and C initially at rest.
After collision, blocks B and C move together with common velocity v.
Mechanical energy loss during collision is difference between initial kinetic energy of block C and final kinetic energy of combined system.
Initial kinetic energy of block C is (1/2)mv0^2.
After collision, combined mass of blocks B and C is 2m, final kinetic energy is mv^2.
Energy loss during collision is (1/2)mv0^2 - mv^2.
Problem states energy loss is (1/2)mv0^2, equate to energy loss expression.
Solving (1/2)mv0^2 - mv^2 = (1/2)mv0^2 gives mv^2 = 0, implies v = 0.
Mechanical energy loss during collision is (1/2)mv0^2.
